snippet: The abortive evacuation was arranged in a small-scale local deal that some aid workers and others had hoped could become a blueprint for building trust.
abstract: Several Syrian civilians are killed and the rest are forced to abort planned evacuation from rebel-held town near Damascus under a brief cease-fire when shells rain down on them from an army post; Army officers say rebels fired first, which rebels deny; evacuation had been arranged in small-scale local deal that some aid workers and other had hoped could become a blueprint for building trust.

byline.contributor: Mohammad Ghannam and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The abortive evacuation was arranged in a small-scale local deal that some aid workers and others had hoped could become a blueprint for building trust.

headline.main: Effort to Evacuate Syrian Civilians Is Thwarted by Shelling
headline.print_headline: Attempted Syrian Evacuation Is Thwarted by Shelling

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
